name: places/ChIJ8UalCadZwokRx_FjI5L-ehw
formattedAddress: 400 W 61st St, New York, NY 10069, USA
adrFormatAddress: 400 W 61st St, New York, NY 10069, USA

originalText.text: I run a professional mentorship and networking organization and we were lucky enough to be hosted for a recent event by a resident of Waterline Square. The pictures that I took do not do justice to the spectacular experience of walking into the lobby and second floor gathering space of Two Waterline Square. Every building staff member that my team and I encountered was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The entire complex has a very pleasant scent in the air, similar to a high-end spa, and it was very quiet/calm for a building that houses several hundred units. Our event took place in the second floor lobby area and it was the perfect setting for a casual networking event. There is a built-in bar, pool table, fireplace, and plenty of lounge furniture, which made it very easy for us to set up an inviting atmosphere for our guests. I have rarely seen such awestruck reactions to a venue in my 7+ years of running these events - Waterline Square is a uniquely special place!

originalText.text:
I am absolutely delighted with my stay at Waterline Square Rentals. This place earns a well-deserved 5/5 rating for its dedication to providing an exceptional living experience. The concierge team is particularly outstanding, with two team members, James and Cameron, deserving special mention. Their attentive care and unwavering dedication to their roles have truly made this place feel like home. Their warm greetings and willingness to assist at any time of the day have greatly enhanced the welcoming atmosphere of Waterline Square. A fantastic rental experience that I highly recommend!

We know the price is on the higher side, and we used to live in VIA apartment. We moved to a bigger place because I just had a baby. If you're thinking about family, this is a perfect place.
Furthermore, the amenities at Waterline Square Rentals are top-notch. The gym is well-equipped with modern machines and there's also a yoga studio for relaxation. I loved the kid's room especially when its cold outside! Cannot beat that convinience

originalText.text: I have lived at Waterline Square (One Waterline Square) as a tenant since it opened in 2020 and it's truly been a wonderful experience. The apartments tend to be much larger than the rest of Manhattan (many one bedrooms around 1,000 square feet) and all of the furnishes and appliances are top notch. The maintenance team is also the best I have ever worked with, and essentially all maintenance issues were completely fixed in less than 24 hours (even minor/.cosmetic issues). The best thing for me about living at Waterline Square was the sense of living in the city while still feeling like I lived in a place where I could get away from the daily hustle of midtown. When you walk the very well manicured Waterline Square park landscapes with your dog, you will feel miles from NYC (and I mean that in the best possible sense). Top notch place to live and I truly recommend it - not your average NYC luxury community.

originalText.text: I recently had the pleasure of working and attending a networking event at Waterline Square, and had a fantastic experience. The staff are friendly and helpful, the amenities are unlike anything I've seen in NYC, and it was truly a pleasure to spend a few hours in this impressive space. Thanks!

originalText.text: Beautiful property and top of the line amenities. Worked with Ari Kliot in the leasing office who is incredibly personable, takes the time to get to know perspective clients and is willing to work with you to find the perfect solution! One of the most accommodating leasing agents I have come across in the metro NY area.
